Generate INSPIRE / GISCO Grid-Cell IDs

Source: R/tph_generage_grid_id.R
tph_generage_grid_id.Rd

Computes standardized grid-cell identifiers for SpatVector, SpatRaster, or sf/sfc objects based on the lower-left (south-west) corner coordinates.

Usage

tph_generage_grid_id(
  x,
  cellsize = NULL,
  crs = NULL,
  style = c("gisco_full", "gisco_short"),
  origin = c(0, 0),
  raster_mask_na = FALSE,
  raster_layer = 1
)

Arguments

x

A SpatVector, SpatRaster, or sf/sfc object.

cellsize

The grid resolution in the units of the object's CRS (e.g., meters). If NULL, it will be inferred from the raster's resolution or the bounding box of the first vector feature (if square).

crs

An optional CRS string (e.g., "EPSG:3035") to use if the object's CRS cannot be automatically determined.

style

The format of the output ID string: "gisco_full" or "gisco_short".

origin

A numeric vector of c(x, y) coordinates for the grid's origin. Defaults to c(0, 0).

raster_mask_na

For SpatRaster input, if TRUE, IDs are only computed for cells that are not NA.

raster_layer

For SpatRaster input, the layer index to use for the NA mask.

Value

A character vector of grid-cell IDs. For SpatRaster inputs, the vector is named with the corresponding cell indices.

Details

This function acts as a wrapper that extracts coordinates from various spatial object types and passes them to the core logic in generate_grid_id_from_coords.

On this page
